{{ page.title }}

Run browser tests right here

  • Unit tests (using AMD modules)
  • Unit tests (using globals)

Run browser tests (with Phantom.js)



Please note that this task has PhantomJS as a dependency.
You also need Istanbul for code coverage.
You can install them globally from NPM: 


npm install -g istanbul
npm install -g phantomjs

Note that on MacOS or GNU/Linux, you may want to install NPM packages with sudo to install them globally on your system:


sudo npm install -g istanbul
sudo npm install -g phantomjs

Once you have installed PhantomJS and Istanbul on your system, you can run the tests and the coverage from your terminal with Gulp: 

gulp test

Notes

All tests are run with Mocha.

Chai is used in the tests as the assertion library.

The coverage page is generated using Istanbul

Browser tests are run from Node.js with PhantomJS
